articles.headline: A long-running feud has broken into open confrontation. Here’s the latest.
articles.snippet: The claims from Yevgeny V. Prigozhin including a veiled threat of an uprising against Russia, prompted the F.S.B. to open a criminal investigation.
articles.abstract: The claims from Yevgeny V. Prigozhin including a veiled threat of an uprising against Russia, prompted the F.S.B. to open a criminal investigation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Russian generals late on Friday accused Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, the outspoken mercenary tycoon, of trying to mount a coup against President Vladimir V. Putin, as the Russian authorities opened an investigation into Mr. Prigozhin for “organizing an armed rebellion.”
articles.byline: By Anton Troianovski and Ivan Nechepurenko

articles.headline: Garland Pushes Back at G.O.P. Claims of Bias in Hunter Biden Investigation
articles.snippet: The attorney general denied assertions that he had interfered with the case and blocked a prosecutor from lodging more charges.
articles.abstract: The attorney general denied assertions that he had interfered with the case and blocked a prosecutor from lodging more charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: Attorney General Merrick B. Garland defended the Justice Department’s five-year investigation of Hunter Biden on Friday, forcefully rebutting claims promoted by House Republicans that he blocked federal prosecutors in Delaware from expanding the inquiry to encompass a greater range of crimes.
articles.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Michael S. Schmidt and Luke Broadwater

articles.headline: House G.O.P. Uses Spending Bills to Pick Partisan Policy Fights
articles.snippet: Republicans are tucking dozens of policy mandates into government funding bills, in an effort to use their majority to force politically charged votes.
articles.abstract: Republicans are tucking dozens of policy mandates into government funding bills, in an effort to use their majority to force politically charged votes.
articles.lead_paragraph: American military installations would be explicitly banned from having drag queen story hours for children.

articles.headline: OceanGate Founder Pushed to Expand Deep Sea Travel Despite Chorus of Concerns
articles.snippet: After his early astronaut dreams were cut short, Stockton Rush was determined to open up underwater exploration and saw his company as the “SpaceX for the ocean.”
articles.abstract: After his early astronaut dreams were cut short, Stockton Rush was determined to open up underwater exploration and saw his company as the “SpaceX for the ocean.”
articles.lead_paragraph: From the start, the plan had been to push boundaries — to go where no one had gone before, as Richard Stockton Rush III liked to say. One partner was experienced in start-ups and passionate about “making humanity a multiplanet species.” The other, Mr. Rush, was an aerospace engineer and investor with a family fortune. Both had once dreamed of going to space.
articles.byline: By Shawn Hubler, Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Anna Betts

articles.headline: Harvard Scholar Who Studies Honesty Is Accused of Fabricating Findings
articles.snippet: Questions about a widely cited paper are the latest to be raised about methods used in behavioral research.
articles.abstract: Questions about a widely cited paper are the latest to be raised about methods used in behavioral research.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the past two decades, dozens of behavioral scientists have risen to prominence pointing out the power of small interventions to improve well-being.

articles.headline: TikTok Is Our DJ Now. It’s Playing a Lot of Meghan Trainor.
articles.snippet: The video app drives streams on Spotify and influences the Billboard charts. Years after she broke through as a musician, the singer is gaining new fans, one viral dance soundtrack at a time.
articles.abstract: The video app drives streams on Spotify and influences the Billboard charts. Years after she broke through as a musician, the singer is gaining new fans, one viral dance soundtrack at a time.
articles.lead_paragraph: Meghan Trainor, the pop star, is sitting in an empty marble bathtub, fully clothed and flanked by two of her friends. The three of them begin soulfully crooning an a cappella version of “Made You Look,” the hit single Ms. Trainor released in the fall, nailing every note for about half a minute. Then they stop, look at one another and scream with delight.

articles.headline: Saudi Arabia Wants Tourists. It Didn’t Expect Christians.
articles.snippet: In a fluid new age for the conservative Islamic kingdom, evangelicals have become some of its most enthusiastic visitors.
articles.abstract: In a fluid new age for the conservative Islamic kingdom, evangelicals have become some of its most enthusiastic visitors.
articles.lead_paragraph: The caravan of five Toyota Land Cruisers raced across Saudi Arabia’s rocky desert, weaving onto a highway so new it was not on the map. At the cleft of sea that splits the kingdom from Egypt, they stopped on a barren beach. Fifteen tourists spilled out and gathered around Joel Richardson, a Kansas preacher.
articles.byline: By Vivian Nereim and Iman Al-Dabbagh

articles.headline: Putin embraced turmoil, and now it is rattling his leadership.
articles.snippet: For more than two decades, the system helped President Vladimir V. Putin secure his unrivaled authority, ensuring that he personally held the keys to wealth and influence in modern Russia.
articles.abstract: For more than two decades, the system helped President Vladimir V. Putin secure his unrivaled authority, ensuring that he personally held the keys to wealth and influence in modern Russia.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia always seemed to thrive on chaos. Then it threatened to consume him.

articles.headline: Rebel Wagner Forces, Threatening March to Moscow, Abruptly Stand Down
articles.snippet: The mercenary group had seized the Russian city of Rostov-on-Don, the center of Moscow’s military operations in Ukraine, posing a grave threat to President Vladimir Putin’s government.
articles.abstract: The mercenary group had seized the Russian city of Rostov-on-Don, the center of Moscow’s military operations in Ukraine, posing a grave threat to President Vladimir Putin’s government.
articles.lead_paragraph: A domestic security crisis that threatened the government of President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia appeared to ease late Saturday, when a mercenary tycoon, whose forces had seized critical facilities in southern Russia and begun an armed march on Moscow, abruptly stood down after cutting a deal that allowed him and his fighters to escape prosecution.

articles.headline: He Tried to Save a Friend. They Charged Him With Murder.
articles.snippet: They bought $30 worth of fentanyl before making it into rehab. One overdosed. The other was charged in his death.
articles.abstract: They bought $30 worth of fentanyl before making it into rehab. One overdosed. The other was charged in his death.
articles.lead_paragraph: Josh Askins woke up in the crawl space of an abandoned house with nausea, chills and a shooting pain in his legs. It had been seven hours since he last smoked fentanyl, and already he could feel his withdrawal symptoms worsening by the minute. He rolled over in his sleeping bag and stared at the graffiti he’d carved into the rotting floorboards. “Fentanyl is HELL,” he had written a few weeks earlier, but now he got up to start looking for more.
articles.byline: By Eli Saslow and Erin Schaff

articles.headline: As Legal Fees Mount, Trump Steers Donations Into PAC That Has Covered Them
articles.snippet: A previously unnoticed change in Donald Trump’s online fund-raising appeals allows him to divert a sizable chunk of his 2024 contributions to a group that has spent millions to cover his legal fees.
articles.abstract: A previously unnoticed change in Donald Trump’s online fund-raising appeals allows him to divert a sizable chunk of his 2024 contributions to a group that has spent millions to cover his legal fees.
articles.lead_paragraph: Facing multiple intensifying investigations, former President Donald J. Trump has quietly begun diverting more of the money he is raising away from his 2024 presidential campaign and into a political action committee that he has used to pay his personal legal fees.
articles.byline: By Shane Goldmacher and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: A.I.’s Use in Elections Sets Off a Scramble for Guardrails
articles.snippet: Gaps in campaign rules allow politicians to spread images and messaging generated by increasingly powerful artificial intelligence technology.
articles.abstract: Gaps in campaign rules allow politicians to spread images and messaging generated by increasingly powerful artificial intelligence technology.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Toronto, a candidate in this week’s mayoral election who vows to clear homeless encampments released a set of campaign promises illustrated by artificial intelligence, including fake dystopian images of people camped out on a downtown street and a fabricated image of tents set up in a park.
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: One Big Winner of Kremlin-Wagner Clash? The Dictator Next Door.
articles.snippet: The strongman leader of Belarus, a dependable ally of Vladimir Putin’s, may see a chance to rebrand himself as a statesman.
articles.abstract: The strongman leader of Belarus, a dependable ally of Vladimir Putin’s, may see a chance to rebrand himself as a statesman.
articles.lead_paragraph: Vladimir V. Putin is known for his tight control over the news media in Russia. His onetime ally, the Wagner military group founder Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, is himself the owner of a conservative media outlet and a flamboyant showman on social media.

articles.headline: Revolt Raises Searing Question: Could Putin Lose Power?
articles.snippet: Russians with ties to the Kremlin expressed relief that the mercenary leader’s mutiny did not spark a civil war. But they agreed that Vladimir Putin had come off looking weak in a way that could be lasting.
articles.abstract: Russians with ties to the Kremlin expressed relief that the mercenary leader’s mutiny did not spark a civil war. But they agreed that Vladimir Putin had come off looking weak in a way that could be lasting.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin long styled himself as Russia’s guarantor of stability and the uncompromising protector of its statehood.

articles.headline: What Is Happening in the Housing Market?
articles.snippet: Home construction surged in May and prices have ticked up, even with interest rates at a 15-year high. The resilience has surprised some economists.
articles.abstract: Home construction surged in May and prices have ticked up, even with interest rates at a 15-year high. The resilience has surprised some economists.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gianni Martinez, 31, thought that it would be fairly easy to buy an apartment.

articles.headline: Trapped in the Crossfire of the U.S.-China Rivalry
articles.snippet: Suriname, a tiny nation ravaged by recession, inflation and impossible debts, saw its relief held up by superpower politics. It won’t be the only country.
articles.abstract: Suriname, a tiny nation ravaged by recession, inflation and impossible debts, saw its relief held up by superpower politics. It won’t be the only country.
articles.lead_paragraph: Inside his capacious office, his tan curtains drawn against the tropical sun, the president of Suriname expressed sympathy with the striking teachers who were massing outside, taunting him while demanding higher wages.
articles.byline: By Peter S. Goodman and Adriana Loureiro Fernandez

articles.headline: In Isolated Guam, Abortion Is Legal. And Nearly Impossible to Get.
articles.snippet: The tiny U.S. territory in the western Pacific Ocean is thousands of miles from the nearest state, and has no resident doctors who perform abortions. Court decisions could cut access to pills, the only legal option left.
articles.abstract: The tiny U.S. territory in the western Pacific Ocean is thousands of miles from the nearest state, and has no resident doctors who perform abortions. Court decisions could cut access to pills, the only legal option left.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, the Pregnancy Control Clinic, tucked inside a squat, beige building around the corner from a bowling alley, handled most of the abortions on Guam, a tiny U.S. territory 1,600 miles south of Japan.
articles.byline: By David W. Chen and Noriko Hayashi

articles.headline: Minefields and Menace: Why Ukraine’s Pushback Is Off to a Halting Start
articles.snippet: The Ukrainian Army is encountering an array of challenges that has complicated the early stages of its counteroffensive, especially the large swaths of minefields. But its leaders are urging patience, insisting the main push is yet to come.
articles.abstract: The Ukrainian Army is encountering an array of challenges that has complicated the early stages of its counteroffensive, especially the large swaths of minefields. But its leaders are urging patience, insisting the main push is yet to come.
articles.lead_paragraph: The column of Bradley armored vehicles rumbled forward, filled with Ukrainian soldiers, bringing a new and potent American weapon to the war’s southern front.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Eric Schmitt and David Guttenfelder

articles.headline: A.I. May Someday Work Medical Miracles. For Now, It Helps Do Paperwork.
articles.snippet: The best use for generative A.I. in health care, doctors say, is to ease the heavy burden of documentation that takes them hours a day and contributes to burnout.
articles.abstract: The best use for generative A.I. in health care, doctors say, is to ease the heavy burden of documentation that takes them hours a day and contributes to burnout.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dr. Matthew Hitchcock, a family physician in Chattanooga, Tenn., has an A.I. helper.
